BNB started in 2017 as a simple fee-discount token on Binance, launched as an ERC-20 on Ethereum. No big ideology â€” just utility.

Over time, it migrated to its own stack: BNB Chain. Fast, cheap, EVM-compatible. A deliberate tradeoff: usability over maximal decentralization.

Why BNB matters:
Low fees let real people use crypto without getting priced out.
Fast confirmations make apps feel normal.
Developers can ship products without massive capital.

BNB didnâ€™t win on narrative.
It won on repetition â€” millions of everyday transactions.

Bitcoin proved digital scarcity.
BNB proves digital infrastructure.

Not hype. An engine.

Notice on Reduction in SWIFT USD Withdrawal Fees on $BNB    As part of our ongoing commitment to enhancing user experience and accessibility, #Binance  is excited to announce a #major  reduction in transaction fees for USD withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer. Effective immediately for both retail and corporate users, the withdrawal fee for direct USD transfers through SWIFT has been lowered from $60 to $25 per transaction. #crypto
